thread.section_title: NWAonline stories: High School Sports - Northwest Arkansas
thread.title: Curley Wolves hold off rally behind Vanhook and Pipkin
thread.title_full: Curley Wolves hold off rally behind Vanhook and Pipkin

author: JAROD DAILY SPECIAL TO THE DEMOCRAT-GAZETTE
title: Curley Wolves hold off rally behind Vanhook and Pipkin
text:
Curley Wolves hold off rally behind Vanhook and Pipkin By JAROD DAILY SPECIAL TO THE DEMOCRAT-GAZETTE Posted: October 24, 2015 at 1:47 a.m. 
PRESOTT 38, BENTON HARMONY GROVE 20 
HASKELL -- Running back Carlos Vanhook's legs and quarterback Trevor Pipkin's arm led Prescottt (6-2, 5-0 5-3A) to their fifth consecutive victory 38-20 over Benton Harmony Grove. 
Vanhook had 16 carries for 167 yards and three touchdowns, including a 54-yard touchdown run late in the fourth quarter and an 11-yard run shortly after the Cardinals (5-3, 2-3) fumbled the ensuing kickoff. His other touchdown was a 3-yard run in the second quarter. 
Pipkin completed 21 of 26 passes for 233 yards and two touchdowns, both short passes to Dequan Malone and Brandon Walker. Pipkin also added 53 rushing yards and completed a pass to Malone on a successful two-point conversion attempt. 
The game was close until Vanhook scored the final two touchdowns with under four minutes left. 
Harmony Grove never led, but did tie the score 6-6 at the end of the first quarter and shaved Prescott's lead to 24-20 in the fourth quarter. 
Running back Jon Johnson led the Cardinals with 209 yards on 29 carries, one touchdown and a successful two-point conversion. Johnson carried the ball on 19 of the Cardinals' 20 third-quarter snaps. 
Quarterback Dakota Rains scored the Cardinals' other two touchdowns, one a 3-yard strike to Brinson Cornwell and the other a 28-yard pass to Alec Shilling. 
The Cardinals twice stopped Prescott at the 1, but ultimately, turnovers doomed Harmony Grove's comeback. One promising third-quarter drive ended when Rains threw an interception, and a fumble on a late kickoff let Prescott put the game away with Vanhook's last score. 
SMACKOVER 28, CAMDEN HARMONY GROVE 7 
CAMDEN — Jordan Jones returned the second half kickoff 75 yards for a touchdown to break open a 14-7 game and lifted Smackover (6-2, 5-0 6-3A) to a victory over Camden Harmony Grove (6-2, 4-1). 
Dewayne Jones added a 1-yard touchdown run and Keiandre Purifoy’s twopoint conversion made it 28-7 with 4:31 left. 
DANVILLE 40, LAMAR 15 
DANVILLE — Jamey Holbrook rushed for 167 yards and scored four touchdowns to help Danville (5-3, 4-1) take a share of first place in the 4-3A Conference with a victory over Lamar (7-1, 4-1). 
Holbrook, who carried nine times, had touchdown runs of 36, 70 and 37 yards. His first touchdown came on a 74-yard pass from Jake Madding. 
Madding rushed 23 times for 152 yards, including a 62-yard touchdown run. Chris Thurman ran 25 yards for Danville’s other touchdown during a three-touchdown third quarter for Danville. 
Lamar scored first on a 2-yard run by Dusty Wilkins. Its only other score was a 50-yard kickoff return by Cody Wyatt in the third quarter, following Thurman’s touchdown. 
GREENLAND 55, 
GREEN FOREST 28 
GREENLAND — Cole Self passed for 170 yards and Alex Sisemore ran for 98 yards as Greenland (8-0, 5-0 1-3A) took control early and rolled past Green Forest (4-5, 2-3). 
Self completed 8 of 13 passes with 3 touchdowns. He also scored on a 1-yard run. Sisemore had rushing touchdowns that covered 15 and 7 yards. 
Carl Roberts led Green Forest with 78 yards rushing, including a 1-yard touchdown, and Dalton Anglin returned a kickoff 70 yards for a touchdown. 
Sports on 10/24/2015
